items.sentence: I don't think Tom knows that Mary is already married.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary thinks he's stupid.
Can you stop by the store on your way home from work?
Tom was able to run faster than me when we were kids.
Tom wasn't the one who asked Mary to do that, was he?
Tom was knocked off his bike by a hit-and-run driver.
Tom spent the last three years of his life in Boston.
Tom asked the waitress some questions about the menu.
Tom isn't waiting outside. He's waiting in the lobby.
As a matter of fact, I don't know anything about Tom.
I think you'd look a lot better without a beard, Tom.
If I go to the party, I'll take some bottles of wine.
If so, it shouldn't be any problem at all, should it?
Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
This painting is nicely done. It looks just like Mom.
The children on the beach are building a sand castle.
I can't promise a reply, but you can send mail to me.
If the shop is closed today, I'll try again tomorrow.
Tom called to say he'd be more than three hours late.
You don't seem to be as confident as Tom seems to be.
